issues.title: Missing Board Policy Document
issues.description: The Board Policy (BP) 4112.9 document is entirely missing. While the Administrative Regulation provides implementation procedures, California Education Code requires board policies to establish the foundational authority and direction for employee notifications. The regulation alone cannot fulfill the governance requirement for board-level policy direction.

legal_citations.text: The governing board of any school district may initiate and carry on any program, activity, or may otherwise act in any manner which is not in conflict with or inconsistent with, or preempted by, any law and which is not in conflict with the purposes for which school districts are established.

issues.required_language: The Board recognizes its legal obligation to provide employees with required notifications and to maintain proper documentation of receipt. The Superintendent or designee shall establish procedures to ensure compliance with all state and federal notification requirements for district employees, including obtaining signed acknowledgments when required by law.

issues.title: Missing Mandated Reporter Training Notification
issues.description: While child abuse reporting obligation is listed, there is no mention of the mandatory training requirement notification. California law requires districts to notify employees about mandated reporter training requirements and maintain records of completion.

legal_citations.text: The training shall be provided to employees who are mandated reporters at least once every two years and to new employees within the first six weeks of each school year or within six weeks of employment.

issues.required_language: Notification of mandatory reporter training requirements, including initial training deadlines and biennial renewal requirements as specified in Education Code Section 44691.

issues.title: Missing Workers' Compensation Notification
issues.description: California Labor Code requires employers to notify employees about workers' compensation benefits and procedures. This mandatory notification is not included in either document.

legal_citations.text: Every employer shall keep posted in a conspicuous location frequented by employees during the hours of the working day a notice concerning workers' compensation, in a form prescribed by the administrative director.

issues.required_language: Workers' compensation benefits information and claim procedures as required by Labor Code Section 3551.

issues.title: Missing Tuberculosis Examination Notification
issues.description: Education Code requires notification to employees about tuberculosis examination requirements for school personnel. This health-related notification requirement is absent from both documents.

legal_citations.text: Each person employed in a school district in a certificated or classified position shall furnish evidence that he or she is free of active tuberculosis.

issues.required_language: Tuberculosis examination requirements and compliance deadlines for all certificated and classified employees as specified in Education Code Section 49406.

issues.title: Outdated Last Review Date
issues.description: The regulation was last reviewed in 2009, which is significantly outdated given the numerous changes in employment law and notification requirements over the past 15 years. While not a legal compliance issue per se, this raises concerns about currency of requirements.

legal_citations.text: The governing board shall review and readopt the policy within 12 months of the effective date of any change in the law that affects the policy.

issues.required_language: Updated review date reflecting current legal requirements and recent statutory changes affecting employee notifications.
